nodes.text: Here you will find all the information you need to learn and expand your knowledge on Data Governance and contribute to the community.                                                           [This is a new CoP page, for any feedback contact:
Do not forget to say hello and introduce yourself on the
meet the community at the HQ during the Data Governance Friday afternoon
. It is the perfect moment to ask questions and discuss issues before a well-deserved after-work.
Here is a list of the experts you can contact in case you have specific questions related to their fields of predilection:
Data Governance Organization, Business Glossary, Data Taxonomy, Data Quality Management, Privacy/legal
We suggest that you choose a mentor who is available enough (
), and ask them all your questions about the theory and/or the practice. Please ask the members of this CoP to say more about their past or current data governance projects.
In addition to mentoring, it is significant to ask questions on the
and to actively participate in the open forums.
we are talking about in the
They are the theoretical modules to discover. The following slides will introduce them:
In the next step, we recommend
. Do not hesitate to challenge or ask your questions to the author. If needed, ask the authorization to access the

After each module, please organize a 30 min Q/A meeting with 2 members of the practice (10 min to present what you learned, 10 min to challenge the module and to be challenged, and 10 min of open discussion about the subject). Do not forget to discuss this with your career manager and your BM to make room for all of this.
The aim is to quickly become an active player, when you got the knowledge, go challenge it with the material done on practical cases.
After reading it, please organize another 30 min Q/A session with 2 members of the practice (same structure).Â
It is up to you to take inspiration from this methodology, to be able to propose the most suitable one for each of our clients.
Finally, offer to help and support someone on a current DG project.
Enhancing the community as a knowledgeable member
If you think you can challenge and/or improve the CoP with your experience, do not hesitate to reach out to the community.
The concrete actions you could take:
Come to the HQ on Friday afternoon to discuss with the community and share your knowledge with colleagues, especially the novices.
Complete your learning journey by going through all the modules on this page
Discover and improve the hot-topics knowledge at the end of this page.
Share some interesting articles that you found on the NoLi continuous flow with the appropriate Data Governance tags
Speaking of sharingâ¦ Don't hesitate to search for certain words related to Data Governance in Nova Libris. You might come across some very interesting pages, of which here is an overview:
Collibra Data Governance Lead Learning Path
